performance_metrics.name: Qubit Coherence Time
performance_metrics.description: The duration for which a qubit maintains its superposition state.  Crucial for complex computations. Measured in milliseconds.

performance_metrics.name: Qubit Fidelity
performance_metrics.description: The accuracy of quantum gate operations. Higher fidelity minimizes errors in calculations. Expressed as a percentage.

performance_metrics.name: Gate Error Rate
performance_metrics.description: The probability of an error occurring during a single quantum gate operation. Lower is better. Measured as a percentage.

performance_metrics.name: Computational Power (Quantum Volume)
performance_metrics.description: A measure of a quantum computer's overall performance, considering qubit count, connectivity, and gate fidelity.  Higher volume indicates greater computational capability.  A relative measure; 1000 represents a sufficient baseline for some optimization problems.

performance_metrics.name: Number of Qubits
performance_metrics.description: The total number of qubits available for computation. Scalability is a primary driver of this metric.  Minimum 500 for tackling moderately complex simulations.

performance_metrics.name: Gate Connectivity
performance_metrics.description: The percentage of possible connections between qubits, allowing for more efficient algorithms. Higher connectivity minimizes SWAP operations, improving performance.

performance_metrics.name: Circuit Depth
performance_metrics.description: The number of quantum gates within a single circuit.  Higher depth increases the probability of errors due to decoherence. Measured in gates.

implementation_requirements.name: Cryogenic Cooling System
implementation_requirements.specification: Liquid Helium Cooling System, operating at 15-20 Kelvin, with a cooling capacity of 500-1000 Watts.
implementation_requirements.description: Essential for maintaining qubit coherence. Includes redundant cooling systems for reliability.

implementation_requirements.name: Shielding Environment
implementation_requirements.specification: Faraday Cage dimensions: 10m x 10m x 5m, with a shielding effectiveness of >99.99dB against electromagnetic interference.
implementation_requirements.description: Minimizes environmental noise that can disrupt qubit coherence. Precise monitoring of external electromagnetic fields is required.

implementation_requirements.name: Control Electronics
implementation_requirements.specification: High-speed digital signal processing (DSP) system with a clock rate of 1 GHz or higher, capable of generating and controlling microwave pulses with a precision of +/- 10 ps.
implementation_requirements.description: Used to manipulate qubit states. Requires robust error correction protocols.

implementation_requirements.name: Software Platform
implementation_requirements.specification: Quantum programming language (e.g., Qiskit, Cirq), high-level quantum algorithm libraries, and a graphical user interface (GUI) for circuit design and execution.
implementation_requirements.description: Enables developers to create and run quantum algorithms efficiently.

implementation_requirements.name: Data Acquisition System
implementation_requirements.specification: Multiple high-speed analog-to-digital converters (ADCs) with a sampling rate of 10 kHz or higher, capable of capturing qubit state measurements.
implementation_requirements.description: Needed to monitor and analyze qubit behavior. Crucial for error mitigation strategies.

industry_standards: ANSI/IEEE 1761 â€“ 2014 - Quantum Random Number Generators
operational_considerations: Qubit Drift Correction: Continuous monitoring and correction of qubit frequency drifts.
Error Mitigation Techniques: Implementation of active and passive error mitigation strategies (e.g., dynamical decoupling, zero-noise extrapolation).
Calibration Protocols: Regularly scheduled calibration routines to ensure accurate qubit control.
Personnel Training: Specialized training for quantum algorithm developers, control engineers, and system administrators.
Predictive Maintenance: Utilizing machine learning to predict qubit degradation and schedule maintenance proactively.

input.system_message: You are an AI assistant specialized in industrial engineering and specifications. For the given topic, provide a comprehensive overview of industrial/commercial specifications including performance metrics and implementation requirements. Be precise with numerical values and include ranges where appropriate. Focus on practical technical details that would be relevant to professionals in the field.
input.user_message:
Create detailed industrial specifications for: Quantum Computing

Format your response as a JSON object with these categories:
1. performance_metrics: An array of metrics with names, values/ranges, and descriptions
2. implementation_requirements: An array of requirements with names, specifications, and descriptions
3. industry_standards: An array of relevant standards and certifications
4. key_suppliers: An array of major equipment/technology suppliers for this industry
5. operational_considerations: An array of important operational factors

Please provide realistic values for industrial/commercial scale implementations.

Return ONLY valid JSON without any additional text, explanation, or code block formatting.
